skillTree.name: Chaos Steed
skillTree.description: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

skillTree.name: Chaos Warshrine
skillTree.description: A vast, mobile altar allows the souls of the slain to be ritualistically condemned directly from the field of slaughter.

ui_effects.description: Summons a unit of Pink Horrors
Summons a unit of Pink Horrors

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Gate of Tzeentch"

ui_effects.description: Summons a unit of Pink Horrors

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +2 for "Gate of Tzeentch"

skillTree.name: Invulnerable Through Change
skillTree.description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

skillTree.name: Hates Nurgle
skillTree.description: Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Cascading Fire Cloak"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Increase Mobility
skillTree.description: Whether it be training harder, travelling lighter, eating less or sleeping better, there's always a way to draw more from the day.

effects.description: Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 5%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 10%
Increase Mobility action: Movement range is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.name: Spread Corruption
skillTree.description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Tzeentch corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Tzeentch corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Tzeentch corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.name: Damage Walls
skillTree.description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.name: Wound
skillTree.description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.name: Hinder Replenishment
skillTree.description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.name: Specialist
skillTree.description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

backgroundSkills.name: Aggressive
backgroundSkills.description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.

backgroundSkills.name: Confident
backgroundSkills.description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Cunning
backgroundSkills.description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.name: Disciplined
backgroundSkills.description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.

backgroundSkills.name: Fleet-Footed
backgroundSkills.description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

backgroundSkills.name: Intelligent
backgroundSkills.description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Knowledgeable
backgroundSkills.description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

backgroundSkills.name: Strategist
backgroundSkills.description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Strong
backgroundSkills.description: Well built, robust. Powerful.

backgroundSkills.name: Tactician
backgroundSkills.description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Tough
backgroundSkills.description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

backgroundSkills.name: Weapon Master
backgroundSkills.description: If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.

backgroundSkills.name: Pinioned
backgroundSkills.description: Blessed with the transformative boons of Tzeeneth, this one can travel further by his feathered wings, whether they be figurative or literal.

backgroundSkills.name: Channeller
backgroundSkills.description: This one has become the conduit through which the Great Conspirator weaves His sorcerous webs, affecting glorious Change through magical means.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.name: Corrupter
backgroundSkills.description: This one seeks to sow the seeds of confusion, dissent and dishonesty, for such are the insidious ways of the Changer.

backgroundSkills.name: Keymaster
backgroundSkills.description: "Are you the Gatekeeper?"

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.name: Conductor
backgroundSkills.description: This hero excels at channeling base magic from the Empyrean to its allies, though quantity over quality is a method with poor utility for wizardry.

backgroundSkills.name: Coordinator
backgroundSkills.description: Volley fire exercises with this hero ensure that ranged firepower is brought to bear, accurately and efficiently, at any range.

backgroundSkills.name: Sorcerous Scales
backgroundSkills.description: Excess magic is repurposed into a powerful enchant over the army, protecting them under Tzeentch's chromatic wings.

backgroundSkills.name: Immolation Ascendant
backgroundSkills.description: A talent for commanding Aqshy offers this sorcerer surprising utility on the battlefield, excelling at destroying fortified positions.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Piercing Bolts of Burning"

backgroundSkills.name: Liquefying Flame
backgroundSkills.description: The sight of a massive flaming skull screaming across the battlefield can bend or break lines other magic would fail to impact.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Burning Head"

backgroundSkills.name: Bringer of Rhuin
backgroundSkills.description: A bit of an odd duck among his allies, this hero specializes in supporting human infantry, granting them the versatility to take on all comers.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flaming Sword of Rhuin"

backgroundSkills.name: Herald of Doom
backgroundSkills.description: The devastating power of a colossal comet of dark magic is hard to deny, for onlookers and victims alike.

backgroundSkills.name: Leechlord
backgroundSkills.description: Spinning a fragment of the winds of Shyish into spells is dangerous work, but allows the caster to regain a surprising volume of magic in their aftermath.

backgroundSkills.name: Spiteful Conjurer
backgroundSkills.description: Dhar is the combination of all eight winds of magic - chaotic and destructive. A useful tool nonetheless, or perhaps because of that, for those seeking destruction.

backgroundSkills.name: Bringer of Flame
backgroundSkills.description: Aqshy and warpfire are but two sides of the same coin, and this one is the metal in between.

backgroundSkills.name: Power Overwhelming
backgroundSkills.description: Power is measured by success; any amount of risk can be justified with results.

backgroundSkills.name: Sorcerous Mastery
backgroundSkills.description: A stellar sorcerer, potent and precise. They may not excel at any one thing, but their control over spells is never found wanting.

effects.description: Passive ability: Heart of the Storm

backgroundSkills.name: Windsinger
backgroundSkills.description: A natural talent for manipulating the Winds helps surround this one in sorcerous power, a useful tool for themselves or others wishing to benefit from it.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.name: Quickcast
backgroundSkills.description: Snapping from one spell to the next at breakneck speeds betrays the truth of practiced precision rather than careless concantenation.

backgroundSkills.name: Efficiency
backgroundSkills.description: Bending the winds effectively, without wasting a mote of energy, is the essence of superior sorcery.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for all spells
